law.catch_line: Judicial circuits with three Circuit Judges and three numbered divisions.
law.text:
The following judicial circuits are entitled to three (3) Circuit Judges and shall have three (3) numbered divisions of the Circuit Court:
Second Judicial Circuit.
Third Judicial Circuit.
Fourteenth Judicial Circuit.
Seventeenth Judicial Circuit.
Twenty-seventh Judicial Circuit.
Twenty-eighth Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-first Judicial Circuit.
Thirty-fifth Judicial Circuit.
Forty-eighth Judicial Circuit.
Fifty-fourth Judicial Circuit.
law.history: Amended 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 250, Pt. V, sec. 2, effective January 1, 2007. -- Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 173, Pt. XIII, 1.(3), sec. 2, effective July 15, 2006. -- Amended 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 66, sec. 5, effective June 24, 2003. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 541, sec. 2, effective July 1, 2000. -- Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 517, secs. 4 and 12, effective September 1, 1998, and September 1, 1999.

metadata.lrc-note: (1/1/2007). 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 250, Pt. V, sec. 6, provides that the new judgeships created by subsections (3) and (10) of this statute shall become effective January 1, 2007.
